abstractText: Stream flow or discharge is the volume of water passing through a streamper unit time. A simple way to estimate discharge is to multiply a cross-sectionalarea by the average velocity of the water. Stream velocity (recorded in ft/s) andthe cross-sectional area (ft2) produce volume per unit time (ft3/s). However,water in a channel flows at different speeds depending on its location. It istherefore necessary to divide a stream cross-section into subsections anddetermine the discharge of each subsection. The total of all the sectiondischarges equals the total stream discharge.
title: Calculate Total Stream Discharge v1.0
